oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Carnton home
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Front view of the Carnton home.

Former Nashville Mayor Randal McGavock (1768-1843) built Carnton in 1826. The original home was a red brick Federal-style home. Later additions included the Greek Revival-style portico by McGavock's son, John McGavock. The home played an important role in the Civil War during the Battle of Franklin, with the house serving as a temporary field hospital. The McGavock Confederate Cemetery, a large military cemetery, is located on the property.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Carnton Mansion (Franklin, Tenn.); Dwellings--Tennessee
Houses; Historic sites
